pages.text: Long ago, when many magical traditions were not yet forgotten, and knowledge was not condemned and the knowledgeable were not burned at the stake, there existed a strong connection between the Upper and Lower realms. The portals that exist today were then only the domain of the poorest novices. There were other ways of communication between dimensions, and wizards on both sides maintained contact.
The Site of Summoning, once a platform for opening gates of communication between realms. Mages on both sides of the veil kept the gates open, making deals with inhabitants of the Inferno.

pages.title: Sites of Summoning
pages.text: Since then, much time has passed, and even now travelers in the Nether stumble upon ruins of places that once connected worlds. In these places, the magic of the Abyss is particularly strong, and many sorcerers journey there in search of a potent source to bolster their magic where the aura of the Overworld falters. These ruins are also of great interest to demonologists.

pages.title: Sites of Summoning
pages.text: Here, touching the threads of magic that permeate the entire Abyss is especially simple.
